title: Govt's diplomatic outreach team: Congress has tough call to take as rift with Tharoor widens
content: Shashi Tharoor's acceptance of a government nomination for a global outreach team has stirred controversy within the Congress party, especially after his comments on the conflict with Pakistan. Jairam Ramesh criticized the government's nomination process as dishonest. BJP leaders questioned Congress's decision not to nominate Tharoor, citing potential jealousy or intolerance.

title: Watch: Mexican navy ship crashes into NYC's Brooklyn Bridge; over 20 injured
content: A Mexican Navy training vessel, the Cuauhtémoc, collided with the Brooklyn Bridge while sailing on the East River, causing visible damage to the ship's mast. The incident, captured in viral videos, showed the mast striking the bridge, adorned with a large Mexican flag. Authorities are investigating the collision, with no immediate reports of injuries or damage to the bridge structure.

title: 'Observation in 3rd stage': Isro's PSLV-C61/EOS-09 launch mission fails
content: ISRO's PSLV-C61 mission, intended to deploy the EOS-09 earth observation satellite, failed after normal performance until the second stage. An observation during the third stage led to the mission's incompletion. This was the third failure for PSLV, despite the vehicle performing as expected in the initial phases. EOS-09 aimed to enhance India's earth observation capabilities with its advanced radar imaging.

title: Doctor booked for distributing 'Eid sweets' day after Pahalgam attack
content: A junior resident doctor at AIIMS-Rishikesh faces charges of promoting enmity after allegedly distributing sweets following a terror attack in Pahalgam. A VHP district president filed the complaint, claiming the act hurt sentiments and appeared to celebrate the killings.

title: 'Used to beat her for dowry': UP man chops wife’s body into pieces
content: In Shravasti, Mohammed Saifuddin was arrested for the murder of his wife, Sakina, after she allegedly nagged him about being unemployed. Saifuddin confessed to killing Sakina, chopping her body into pieces, and disposing of them in a forest and a pond.

title: Microsoft CEO says only DeepSeek R1 rivals OpenAI—not Google or xAI
content: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella lauded DeepSeek's R1 as a formidable competitor to OpenAI's models, surpassing even Google's Gemini in performance. This recognition, along with praise from OpenAI's Sam Altman and Google's Sundar Pichai, highlights DeepSeek's significant impact on the AI landscape. R1's cost-effectiveness has stirred market concerns about AI hardware demand.

title: Virat Kohli's T20 record in jeopardy; KL Rahul set to rewrite history
content: Delhi Capitals are contemplating promoting KL Rahul to the opener position for their crucial IPL 2025 match against Gujarat Titans. Rahul is on the verge of becoming the fastest Indian to score 8000 T20 runs, needing just 33 runs to surpass Virat Kohli's record. However, Rashid Khan of Gujarat Titans could pose a threat to Rahul's milestone.

title: Spy whispers refuse to subside in Hisar after arrest of vlogger Jyoti Malhotra
content: Hisar, a key military center in Haryana, faces renewed national security concerns following the arrest of a local YouTuber for alleged espionage. With a history of ISI activity spanning over two decades, the city, home to vital military assets, has been a target for Pakistani intelligence.

title: How Jyoti Malhotra passed secret information to Pakistan: Apps used and more
content: Indian YouTuber Jyoti Malhotra, known for her "Travel with JO" channel, has been arrested in Hisar on suspicion of spying for Pakistan. Police allege Malhotra shared sensitive information with Pakistani intelligence operatives via WhatsApp, Telegram, and Snapchat. Officials claim her actions violate the Official Secrets Act and pose a national security threat.

title: In her own YouTube videos, proof of vlogger Jyoti Malhotra links to Pak revealed
content: Jyoti Malhotra, a travel vlogger with a significant online presence, has been arrested for allegedly spying for Pakistan. She maintained contact with Pakistani intelligence, attended events at the Pakistan High Commission, and frequently praised Pakistan on social media. Investigations reveal she shared sensitive information and received assistance from Pakistani officials for visa extensions and stays during her visits.

title: 'Could feel the vibration': At least 27 killed as violent storms rip through US
content: Devastating tornadoes and severe storms have ripped through Kentucky, Missouri, and Virginia, resulting in at least 27 fatalities and numerous injuries. Kentucky was hit hardest, with 18 deaths, while Missouri experienced significant damage from an EF-3 tornado in St. Louis.

title: 'CSK in jail for two years ... ': Fans slammed for mocking Dhoni
content: Chennai Super Kings have faced disappointing seasons, leading to intense fan rivalry, particularly with RCB. Robin Uthappa criticized some RCB fans for mocking CSK's suspension with 'CSK jail' jerseys and heckling supporters, deeming it unsportsmanlike. Meanwhile, RCB's victory and KKR's washout have significantly impacted the IPL playoff race, with RCB now leading the points table.

title: Govt slams Amazon, Flipkart for selling Pakistani flags
content: The CCPA has issued notices to e-commerce platforms like Amazon and Flipkart for selling Pakistani national flags and merchandise, deemed insensitive and a violation of national sentiment. Union Minister Pralhad Joshi directed the platforms to immediately remove such listings and adhere to national laws.

title: Gujarat man keeps up family tradition of marrying two women
content: In Gujarat's Navsari district, Meghraj Deshmukh is continuing his family's unique tradition by marrying two women, Kajal and Rekha, with whom he already has three children. Following in the footsteps of his father and grandfather, this unusual arrangement is accepted within their community. The women live harmoniously, supporting each other and Meghraj in their family business.

title: 2 jihadists, one with Lashkar-e-Taiba link, on Trump's White House panel
content: The Trump regime appointed Ismail Royer and Shaykh Hamza Yusuf to the White House Advisory Board. Both have alleged ties to Islamic jihadists. Lara Loomer, a Trump ally, criticized Royer's appointment. Royer was convicted in 2004 for terrorist activities. He admitted to aiding individuals in joining a Lashkar-e-Taiba training camp.

title: With Op Sindoor still on, military gets emergency purchase powers
content: Amidst tensions with Pakistan and a strategic pause in Operation Sindoor, India has granted its armed forces emergency procurement powers with a budget of approximately Rs 40,000 crore. This move allows the Army, IAF, and Navy to quickly replenish arms stockpiles and acquire advanced weaponry like missiles, drones, and precision-guided munitions.

title: Shocking statement! 'Asli fans Dhoni ke hain, baaki sab paid'
content: MS Dhoni's immense popularity in Chennai and across India is undeniable, with fans displaying unwavering support for 'Thala.' Harbhajan Singh emphasized the genuine affection Dhoni receives, distinguishing it from manufactured social media followings. Meanwhile, things haven’t gone CSK’s way over the past two seasons. ​​​The five-time IPL champions failed to reach the playoffs in 2024 and endured another underwhelming campaign in IPL 2025.

title: 'Virat Kohli deserves Bharat Ratna'
content: Suresh Raina advocates for Virat Kohli to receive the Bharat Ratna, recognizing his significant contributions to Indian cricket. Raina emphasized Kohli's achievements and impact on the nation's cricketing landscape, urging the Indian government to bestow the prestigious award upon him. Kohli recently retired from Test cricket, marking the end of an era.

title: The inside story of a seamless Operation Sindoor
content: Following a deadly attack on tourists, India launched Operation Sindoor, targeting terrorist headquarters in Pakistan. Prime Minister Modi authorized a decisive response, overcoming concerns about Pakistan's nuclear capabilities and international pressure. Indian forces utilized intelligence and loitering munitions to strike key locations, showcasing advancements in military technology and joint operations, ultimately compelling Pakistan to seek a ceasefire.

title: Travis Kelce bonds with Mahomes’ sister Mia at gala, wins Swift family nod
content: At the 15 and the Mahomies charity gala in Las Vegas, Travis Kelce shared a heartwarming moment with Patrick Mahomes' sister, Mia. An Instagram post captured Kelce and Mia's genuine smiles, radiating a sense of family. The event, filled with love and purpose, supported Patrick's foundation, emphasizing meaningful connections and positive impact.

title: Sharif admits Nur Khan base was struck: ‘Munir rang me up at 2.30am’
content: Pakistani Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif has formally acknowledged that India conducted missile strikes on the Nur Khan airbase in Rawalpindi on May 9-10. This admission contradicts previous Pakistani statements that downplayed the extent of the damage. BJP leaders have asserted that Sharif's words confirm the scale and precision of Operation Sindoor.

title: In a 1st, we destroyed terror camps 100km inside Pakistan: Amit Shah
content: Amit Shah stated that India retaliated strongly after the Pahalgam terror attack. Indian forces destroyed terror camps inside Pakistan. This action demonstrated India's firm response to terrorism. Shah highlighted previous responses to Uri and Pulwama attacks. He mentioned the destruction of terrorist training camps. According to Shah, India's armed forces eliminated nearly 100 terrorists.

title: YouTuber held for spying, tied to expelled Pakistan intel operative
content: Haryana police arrested travel vlogger Jyoti Malhotra from Hisar for allegedly spying and sharing sensitive information with Pakistani intelligence. She is accused of circulating pro-Pakistan content and maintaining encrypted contact with Pakistani operatives. Police seized her devices and are investigating her bank records, marking the seventh espionage-related arrest in the region since May 7.

title: 'Felt like bomb went off': Huge explosion rocks Palm Springs, 1 killed
content: A powerful explosion rocked Palm Springs, California, on Saturday morning, resulting in one fatality and prompting a large-scale emergency response. The blast, which occurred near North Indian Canyon Drive and East Tachevah Drive, led to the deployment of ATF investigators.

title: Delhi HC orders CBI & forensic probe into JEE Mains score ‘mismatch’
content: The Delhi High Court has ordered a CBI probe, including a forensic examination, into alleged manipulation of JEE (Mains) 2025 scorecards following claims of discrepancies by two candidates. The court directed the Central Forensic Science Laboratory (CFSL) to expedite the inquiry and submit findings by May 22, ahead of the JEE (Advanced) 2025 results.

title: Techie dies as car owner rams bike after tiff over cigarettes
content: In Bengaluru, a fatal road rage incident occurred when a software engineer died after an SUV rammed his bike following a dispute over cigarettes. Sales executive Prateek R, angered when Chetan and Sanjay H N refused to buy him cigarettes, allegedly hit their bike, leading to Sanjay's death and Prateek's arrest for murder. CCTV footage confirmed the intentional ramming.

title: Cong livid as govt ignores its list for foreign outreach, picks Tharoor
content: A controversy has erupted after the Indian government selected Shashi Tharoor to lead a delegation on 'Operation Sindoor', despite Congress's disapproval and alternative recommendations. This decision has ignited accusations of political maneuvering and disregard for party preferences. The situation highlights a growing rift between Tharoor and Congress, potentially leading to a critical juncture in their relationship amid upcoming elections.

title: MEA refutes Rahul Gandhi claim EAM ‘informed’ Pakistan about strikes
content: MEA strongly refuted Rahul Gandhi's allegation that Jaishankar informed Pakistan about Operation Sindoor, labeling it an "utter misrepresentation of facts." The MEA clarified that Pakistan was warned after the operation's commencement, not before. PIB's Fact Check Unit also debunked the claim, stating the EAM's remarks were selectively edited to mislead.

title: In blow to Bangladesh, govt shuts land route for garment imports
content: India has restricted imports from Bangladesh, including a ban on readymade garments via land routes, amidst growing tensions with the interim administration. This retaliatory move follows Bangladesh's restrictions on Indian yarn and rice. While key items like fish and edible oil are spared, the ban impacts a significant portion of Bangladesh's garment exports to India.

title: Op Sindoor: Azad, Akbar, Anand Sharma also on foreign outreach teams
content: India is launching 'Operation Sindoor,' sending seven all-party delegations to key nations worldwide to reinforce its commitment to combating terrorism. Fifty-one political leaders, including parliamentarians and former ministers from various parties, will participate in these delegations, each assisted by former diplomats. The initiative aims to convey a unified message of India's resolve against terrorism on a global scale.

title: At 1.5 lakh, pedestrians made up 20% of road deaths in 5 years
content: Nearly 1.5 lakh pedestrians died in India from 2019-2023, highlighting their vulnerability despite having right-of-way. A Supreme Court panel audit revealed that footpath availability varies widely across states, often not meeting standards. The court emphasized pedestrians' rights under Article 21, advocating for accessible, encroachment-free footpaths as a crucial, low-cost safety measure.

title: 4,000 ex-troops to guard vital infrastructure across J&K
content: The J&K government has approved deploying 4,000 ex-servicemen to protect vital infrastructure across the Union territory. These veterans will perform non-combatant duties, including static guard duties and local coordination, at power stations, bridges, and government installations. Around 435 personnel possess licensed weapons, enhancing their ability to respond to localized security situations.

title: Gujarat minister’s son held in Rs 71 crore MGNREGS scam case
content: Balwant Khabad, son of Gujarat minister Bachu Khabad, has been arrested in connection with a Rs 71 crore MGNREGS scam in Dahod. He and his brother are linked to firms that received undue payments for NREGA projects. The scam involved 32 firms and inflated projects, prompting calls for a special investigation team.

title: SC bars Centre from granting retrospective green clearances
content: The Supreme Court has affirmed that the right to a pollution-free environment is a fundamental right, invalidating a central government memorandum that permitted retrospective environmental clearances for projects violating established norms. The court strongly criticized the government's attempt to circumvent the law, emphasizing the constitutional obligation to protect the environment.

title: Massive search op launched in J&K’s Samba to trace 3 terror suspects
content: Security forces have initiated a joint search operation in the Samba district of Jammu and Kashmir. This action follows reports of suspected terrorist movement in the forest area. Police and central armed forces are combing Nangal, Chilladanga and Goran. Locals reported suspicious activity. Similar search operations were conducted recently in Reasi and Samba districts based on similar reports.

title: J&K CM, LG call for peace as India prepares to send all-party team abroad
content: Following Operation Sindoor and heightened tensions, J&K CM Omar Abdullah and LG Manoj Sinha affirmed India's dedication to peace while defending military actions against Pakistan-backed terrorism. India is preparing to dispatch an all-party parliamentary delegation abroad to articulate its position. Sinha highlighted Pakistan's request for mediation after Indian forces struck terrorist camps, emphasizing India's focus on development and peace.

title: Cop, 30, dies trying to save criminals from drowning
content: In a tragic incident near Bijnor, Constable Manoj Kumar lost his life while attempting to rescue suspects whose vehicle plunged into a canal after a high-speed chase. Despite suffering a fatal electric shock from downed power lines, he heroically alerted his colleagues to the danger, preventing further casualties. Police have arrested two suspects and are pursuing the remaining fugitives.

title: HC upholds appointment of AMU’s 1st woman vice-chancellor
content: Allahabad High Court has validated professor Naima Khatoon's appointment as Aligarh Muslim University's Vice-Chancellor, dismissing challenges to the selection process. The court emphasized the adherence to regulations and hailed the appointment as a progressive step for gender representation. Khatoon expressed faith in the judiciary, viewing the verdict as a reaffirmation of democratic values within the higher education system.

title: Meerut varsity adds Ramayana, Mahabharata in journalism course
content: Chaudhary Charan Singh University (CCSU) has incorporated 'Bhartiya Sanchar ke Praroop' into its MA-JMC program. The course aims to educate students about traditional Indian communication methods found in epics like the Ramayana and Mahabharata. CCSU official states that this initiative blends ancient wisdom with modern journalism, highlighting examples like Sanjay's live narration and Hanuman's role as a messenger.

title: Vyapam: 4 MBBS candidates among 10 given 3 years' rigorous imprisonment
content: A Bhopal CBI court has sentenced ten individuals, including four candidates, to three years in jail for fraudulent MBBS admissions via the PMT-2009 Vyapam exam. The convicted include candidates, impersonators, and a middleman, all fined Rs 16,000. The case, initially registered in 2015, was taken over by the CBI following Supreme Court directives, revealing widespread irregularities in MBBS admissions.

title: UAE pours money into Africa, seeking resources, power
content: The United Arab Emirates is significantly increasing its economic influence in Africa, investing heavily in key sectors like ports, mining, and renewable energy. With the United States and China reducing their presence, the UAE has pledged billions in deals, surpassing other nations' investments. This strategic move aims to diversify the UAE's economy and capitalize on Africa's resources and strategic location.

title: 22 kids among 90 from Bangladesh held in Mathura
content: In Mathura, authorities detained 90 Bangladeshi nationals, including children, for allegedly residing illegally in India, seizing documents and mobile phones. They were found working at brickyards, having crossed borders years ago. Simultaneously, Uttarakhand police arrested a US citizen and a Bangladeshi woman for lacking valid residency documents, highlighting ongoing efforts to address illegal immigration.

title: Sambhal violence: Charges framed against 50 accused, trial to begin
content: A local court in Sambhal has framed charges against 50 individuals accused of involvement in the violence that erupted at the Shahi Jama Masjid last November, where five lives were lost. The clashes stemmed from a survey conducted amidst claims of the mosque's prior existence as a Harihar temple.

title: Madras HC stays NEET-2025 results over power cut row
content: Madras High Court has put a hold on the NEET-2025 results. This follows petitions from 13 candidates. They claim a power cut at an Avadi exam center near Chennai disrupted their test. Justice V Lakshminarayanan has asked the National Testing Agency to respond by June 2. Students faced issues like poor lighting and rainwater.

title: Who Is Jyoti Malhotra, Haryana Travel YouTuber Arrested Over Spying For Pakistan
content: Jyoti Malhotra had posted multiple videos and reels from Pakistan, showing her visit to Lahore's Anarkali Bazaar, Katas Raj Temple, and a bus journey across the country.

title: Video: Mexican Navy Ship Hits New York's Brooklyn Bridge, People Seen Hanging On To Masts
content: A Mexican navy sailing ship, about 297 feet long and 40 feet wide, crashed into the Brooklyn Bridge during a promotional tour in New York City.

title: "She Visited Pakistan To Shoot Videos": Father Of Travel YouTuber Arrested For Spying
content: Jyoti Malhotra was arrested for allegedly sharing sensitive information and being in continuous contact with a Pakistani citizen.

title: How BJP's Nishikant Dubey Reacted To Teaming Up With Asaduddin Owaisi
content: Senior BJP leader Nishikant Dubey has said the Centre's decision to put him and AIMIM MP Asaduddin Owaisi in the delegation that will travel to Muslim countries to expose Pakistan's link with terrorism shows the "most beautiful face of democracy".

title: NDTV Explains: Why ISRO's EOS-9 Satellite Launch Failed
content: ISRO's 63rd PSLV launch to put the EOS-9 surveillance satellite in orbit could not be accomplished as the launch failed during the third stage due to a fall in pressure.

title: ISRO's 101st Big Rocket Launch Takes Flight, Loses Satellite Minutes Later
content: The 101st launch was done with PSLV-C61, carrying an Earth Observation Satellite, named as EOS-09 which will be put in a Sun Synchronous Polar Orbit (SSPO).

title: Mexican Navy Training Vessel Hits New York's Brooklyn Bridge
content: A Mexican navy sailing ship hit the Brooklyn Bridge, the top of its three masts slamming into the iconic span and partially collapsing.

title: UK, US, Middle East: India's Mega Diplomatic Outreach - Who Goes Where
content: The seven delegations that have been formed to convey India's message of zero-tolerance against terrorism have 59 members, including 31 politicians from the ruling National Democratic Alliance (NDA) and 20 from other political parties.

title: Day After India's Global Outreach Move, Pakistan Announces Its Own
content: In another example of imitating India after facing humiliation in a four-day military escalation from May 7 to 10 during Operation Sindoor, Pakistan has asked Bilawal Bhutto to present its case on a global stage.

title: A Week After Wedding, UP Man Thrashes Third Wife To Death
content: After two broken marriages, Raju married Aarti on May 9 and immediately after clashes started happening between them.

title: "Unforgivable": Bomb Blast At California Fertility Clinic Kills 1
content: An explosion outside a California fertility clinic killed one person in what the local mayor described as a bomb attack.

title: 200 Passengers 'Fly Without A Pilot' For 10 Minutes. Here's What Happened
content: A Lufthansa flight to Spain last year went without a pilot for 10 minutes after the co-pilot fainted while he was alone in the cockpit, German news agency dpa reported on Saturday.

title: What ISRO Chief Said After EOS-09 Satellite Launch Could Not Be Accomplished
content: ISRO's trusted Polar Satellite Launch Vehicle (PSLV) is a 4-stage rocket and the first two stages were normal, the space agency's Chairman V Narayanan said.

title: Cop Jumps Into Ghaziabad Canal In Bid To Save Woman From Alleged Suicide, Dies
content: A traffic police constable died on Saturday after he jumped into the Hindon Canal to save a woman who was allegedly attempting suicide, officials said.

title: In Centre's Anti-Terror Outreach Teams, Only 1 Name Suggested By Congress
content: The Centre has released the final list of seven all-party delegations that will travel around the world to brief other nations about India's Operation Sindoor. From the Congress party's formal recommendation of four names, only Anand Sharma appeared.

title: iPhone Shipments Likely To Begin In June From Foxconn's Bengaluru Unit
content: Taiwanese electronics manufacturing major Foxconn's facility in Bengaluru is nearly ready for launch, with commercial iPhone shipments expected to begin as early as June, Karnataka Minister for Commerce and Industries, MB Patil, said on Saturday.

title: Video: Man Takes Down Signboard Stuck On High-Tension Wire In Noida
content: An iron signboard was dangling mid-air from a high tension wire, showed a video, as heavy rain and strong winds buffeted Uttar Pradesh's Noida on Saturday.

title: E-Rickshaw Driver Drugs, Rapes 25-Year-Old Woman In Delhi, Arrested: Cops
content: A 25-year-old woman was allegedly drugged, raped and robbed by an e-rickshaw driver in delhi, police said on Thursday.

title: Bumble CEO Lidiane Jones Resigns, Founder To Take On Role Of Chief Executive
content: Dating app operator Bumble said on Friday its founder and executive chair, Whitney Wolfe Herd, will become the chief executive of the company from mid-March after Lidiane Jones resigned as CEO.

title: Menendez Brothers Case Reflects Shifting Culture Across Decades
content: The trials of Lyle and Erik Menendez came at a time of cultural obsession with courts, crime and murder, when live televised trials captivated a national audience.

title: Youth arrested in Haryana's Nuh for spying for Pakistan, say police
content: The accused was arrested for sharing information related to the Indian Army and other military activities with Pakistan through an employee posted at the High Commission of Pakistan in Delhi, Nuh police said

title: A city in transition: From Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike to Greater Bengaluru Authority
content: The GBA aims to fix systemic inefficiencies by creating a unified governance structure that can deliver integrated planning and services

title: ‘Misrepresentation of facts’: MEA clarifies Jaishankar’s ‘warned Pakistan at the start’ of Operation Sindoor remark
content: The clarification came after Rahul Gandhi’s criticism of the government suggesting that the Indian side informed Pakistan ahead of the military strikes on terrorist infrastructure in Pakistan and PoK

title: Homemaker duped of over ₹2.79 lakh with fake children’s talent contest
content: The scam unfolded on May 12, 2025, when the victim was contacted via Facebook by a user operating under the name ‘Erica Wally’.

title: The monsoon’s green energy potential
content: Monsoons are strong drivers of climate: their cool, gusty winds can be predicted and modelled just as rains can be

title: Did Trump cross the line on Kashmir issue? | Explained
content: What are the contours of Indian foreign policy with regard to Jammu and Kashmir? What has the U.S. President said? What has been the experience in the past? What is the stand adopted by India and Pakistan? Is a dialogue with Pakistan possible?

title: Vikram Misri | Face of counter-attack
content: The Foreign Secretary’s adept handling of Operation Sindoor won the praise of colleagues and friends but also exposed him to online trolls

title: Kasturi Ranga Iyengar Charitable Trust donates e-carts to Oppiliappan Temple, govt. hospital
content: Trust Chairperson Dr. Nalini Krishnan hands over 15 sewing machines to women at Innambur near Kumbakonam

title: Minister Lokesh and his family meet PM Modi
content: Mr. Modi unveiled the first copy of the coffee table book Yuvagalam which chronicles the historic 3,132 km padayatra taken out by Mr. Lokesh in the run up to the 2024 elections

title: AAI may take over operation of the multi-level car parking facility at city airport for now
content: The move comes amid complaints over cab pick-up points and congestion of vehicles at entry/exit areas; the existing contractor has given termination notice to AAI due to losses

title: Civil society organisations demand judicial enquiry into Pahalgam terror attack in letter to PM Modi
content: Hate-mongering via media and social media, which fuels distrust and communalism, must be curbed immediately, the statement said

title: Govt. Taluk Hospital in Vaniyambadi inundated after heavy downpour
content: Municipal officials say the hospital is located in a low-lying area near Kannamapudur lake that is heavily encroached upon; its drains are small and built several years ago

title: Major reshuffle in Trinamool’s rank and file, two heavyweights replaced
content: The two organisational districts where the presidents have been replaced by core committees are Birbhum and Kolkata (Uttar), which had several complaints of infighting

title: T.N. will file case against the Centre in SC for withholding funds over language policy: Stalin
content: Releasing a book on the NEP, authored by Minister Anbil Mahesh Poyyamozhi, he says the funds rightfully belong to the State as recommended by the Parliamentary Standing Committee on Education, headed by former M.P. Chief Minister and Congress MP Digvijay Singh

title: Heavy rain in Bengaluru causes chaos, more showers expected till May 21
content: As per the IMD, parts of Karnataka are likely to witness heavy showers and thunderstorms on Sunday, with gusty winds reaching speeds of 40–50 kmph

title: Age concession for direct recruitment into T.N. government service to remain till September 2026
content: In a recent communication, Chief Secretary N. Muruganandam clarified that the decision was a “one-time concession” and added that this would be applicable only to recruitment by various agencies and appointing authorities

title:
Shift in ecosystem of Parambikulam
forests through the eyes of tribes
content: In a seminar held as part of a government initiative, tribespeople have aired concerns regarding the disproportionate surge in peacock population as well as decline of the once-common hump-nosed vipers in the area

title: Application fee for colleges: A tad more than what is necessary
content: The Comptroller Auditor-General’s report on higher education, which was tabled in the Assembly during the recent Budget session, advised the Directorate of Collegiate Education to ensure that self-financing colleges abide by its instructions on application fees. R. Sujatha takes a deep dive to figure out the reality in colleges in Tamil Nadu

title: Pakistan-linked ghost SIM card racket busted in Assam
content: A fraudulently acquired SIM card seized earlier was used to report the movement of Indian troops, says Director General of Police Harmeet Singh

title: Member states pledge troops and support to UN peace keeping missions at Berlin Ministerial
content: The Ministerial comes at a time when the world body is undergoing major internal restructuring, facing major funding cuts by the U.S. and Europe’s increased military spending.

title: All-party delegation to convey India’s united message against terrorism marred by partisan politics
content: Govt. ignores three of the four names suggested by Congress; party doesn’t nominate Shashi Tharoor to represent the party in the diplomatic delegation but government names him; party accuses Centre of ‘playing games’

title: APSDMA launches ‘Smart Heat Alert Card’ that gives real-time temperatures and dos and don’ts
content: On scanning the QR code on the card from a mobile phone, the APSDMA website comes up with real-time temperature in a location presented in a colour-coded box

title: India curbs Bangladeshi exports via land ports
content: Ready-made garments from Bangladesh will be allowed to enter India only through the ports of Kolkata and Mumbai where the cargo shipments will be subjected to ‘mandated inspections’

title: Sangh Parivar-backed trade union boycotts SCO meet on labour issues, faces flak
content: The meeting was organised by the All China Federation of Trade Unions. Leaders of other CTUs, such as All India Trade Union Congress (AITUC) and the Centre of Indian Trade Unions (CITU) have attended the meeting.

title: Pakistan continues using Chinese drones to drop narcotics and arms along Punjab border, BSF data shows
content: Multiple consignments of explosives, weapons, and heroin were recovered by security forces almost daily since the May 10 agreement to halt military actions.

title: States without protection for inter-faith, inter-caste couples in contempt of SC: Mihir Desai
content: Renowned rights lawyer calls for national legislation; credits Bombay HC’s intervention for Maharashtra’s SOPs on safeguarding couples

title: BSF South Bengal Frontier foils gold smuggling attempt, appeals for public help
content: Two smugglers caught with over 1 kg of gold worth ₹1.11 crore at North 24 Parganas border; BSF urges citizens to report smuggling via helpline

title: Brand Bengaluru Committee to propose creating multiple municipal corporations under GBA
content: The committee, chaired by B.S. Patil, held its first formal meeting on Saturday since the Act’s notification and began working on restructuring plans.

title: Bengaluru start-up develops ‘Papchup’, a papaya ketchup
content: Unlike many tomato ketchups, which have around 12%–18% tomato paste, Papchup has 50% papaya pulp; product will help papaya farmers get better prices for their crop, say the developers

title: Sajjala calls upon leaders to strengthen YSRCP for future elections
content: Party committees will be formed at various levels with the aim of enrolling 18 lakh members by the end of the year, says the YSRCP State coordinator

title: 20 Maoists arrested, arms and ammunition seized in Mulugu district
content: They were apprehended during separate vehicle checking and search operations at different places under Venkatapuram, Wazeedu and Kannaigudem police station limits on Friday and Saturday, the police said

title: J&K to employ Ex-Servicemen for guard duties
content: Proposal will see 435 of the ESM, who carry licensed personal weapons, deployed across all 20 districts for non-combatant static guard duties.

title: Clean and green programmes ensure a healthy life, says DGP
content: Harish Kumar Gupta takes part in ‘Swarnandhra – Swachh Andhra’ drive at the State Police Headquarters at Mangalagiri

title: Killer tiger caught on camera
content: Search to continue for the tiger that mauled to death a man at Kalikavu after the animal evaded the forest team.

title: Rajasthan finalises action plan for M-sand plot auctions to curb illegal mining
content: Policy push aims to promote manufactured sand as alternative to riverbed sand, ease supply constraints, and ensure environmental compliance

title: Rahul Gandhi targets Jaishankar’s remarks on informing Pakistan ‘at the start’ of Operation Sindoor
content: The Congress leader’s claims were ‘utter misrepresentation of facts’, the Ministry of External Affairs said

title: Free bus travel for women in Andhra Pradesh from August 15, says Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu
content: It is one of the Super Six promises made by the TDP in the run-up to the elections; rolling out welfare schemes and attracting investments are the government’s twin priorities, he says

title: Shakti scheme a resounding hit in Chamarajanagar
content: There has been a noticeable increase in the number of women visiting religious and tourist destinations across the district

title: Massive blaze guts over 30 shanties in Gurugram slum
content: According to eyewitnesses, the fire spread so fast that people did not even get a chance to take out their belongings from the shanties.

title: BRS MLAs demand roll back of Metro fare hike
content: Address an open letter to CM Revanth Reddy cautioning about people’s backlash if fare hike is not reversed

title: Repeat sexual predator sentenced 25 years of RI within 55 days of complaint in Odisha
content: This case is a powerful example of what proactive policing, scientific evidence gathering, and time-bound prosecution can achieve, says Jharsuguda SP

title: Nobel laureate Abhijit Banerjee to join TelanganaRising advisory board
content: The Nobel laureate spoke of the need to create unique short-term courses in traditional skills with modern design and appeal, marketing and the use of social media technology to help traditional artisans turn into modern entrepreneurs

title: Superstitions becoming widespread in society, says Pinarayi
content: Many national grants supporting research and higher education have now been removed or reduced, says Kerala Chief Minister

title: West Bengal official suspended for ‘tampering’ with electoral application forms
content: According to a notification by the Chief Electoral Officer, the accused misused an electoral official’s login credentials to allegedly dispose of certain application forms

title: Dalit girl missing case: CB arrests key accused after 15 years
content: The case saw progress after a bone fragment and a necklace found near the Kasaragod coast in 2010 were recently identified as belonging to the missing girl. During questioning, Biju reportedly confessed to killing the girl.

title: Ten districts get new District Coordinators of Health Services
content: The move follows the Minister for Health, Medical Education and Family Welfare Y. Satya Kumar Yadav expressing concern over underperformance of a few officials

title: Police resort to lathi charge following tension at procession in Madanapalle
content: Situation turned tense when the rally reportedly took a diversion from the permitted route map and proceeded towards another direction, leading to objections from another group

title: Courts are not outside the ambit of the RTI Act: State Information Commission
content: Observing that officials of some subordinate courts are denying all information sought under the RTI Act, State Information Commissioner A. Abdul Hakkim says only judicial proceedings are exempted from disclosure under the Act

title: Tourist arrivals at all-time high in Idukki: Riyas
content: Tourism Minister virtually inaugurates the Kudiyetta Smarakam museum and District Tourism Promotion Council‘s  photo frames project

title: Two veterans from Andhra Pradesh set sail to Vizag from New Zealand
content: They have embarked on a trans-oceanic sojourn from Opua Bay on a 34-foot-long boat called ‘Tystie’ on May 14, and are expected to reach their first port of call at Savusavu in Fiji in the next 13 days

title: Stars win, oust Presidents' Trophy-winning Jets
content: Defenseman Thomas Harley scored on a power play 1:33 into overtime and the Dallas Stars advanced to the Western Conference final for the third season in a row, beating the top-seeded Winnipeg Jets 2-1 in Game 6 on Saturday to set up a date with Edmonton.

title: Clark, new-look Fever rout Sky in chippy opener
content: The Fever started their season Saturday with a blowout victory over the Sky, a triple-double from Caitlin Clark, a career milestone for Fever newcomer DeWanna Bonner and a kerfuffle between Clark and the Sky's Angel Reese.

title: Scheffler catches fire at PGA, takes 3-shot lead
content: Scottie Scheffler delivered a clinic over the closing stretch at Quail Hollow for a 6-under 65 and a three-shot lead going into the final round of the PGA Championship.

title: Furious finish lifts Journalism to Preakness win
content: Journalism won the Preakness Stakes on Saturday, coming from behind down the stretch to make good on the lofty expectations of being the favorite in the middle leg of the Triple Crown two weeks after finishing second to Sovereignty in the Kentucky Derby.

title: Sources: Celts' Brown has partial meniscus tear
content: Celtics star Jaylen Brown finished the season with a partially torn right meniscus and will be evaluated this coming week to determine if surgery is needed, sources told ESPN.

title: Twins win 13th in row behind 3rd straight shutout
content: Pablo Lopez combined with three relievers on a three-hitter as the Twins beat the Brewers 7-0 on Saturday for their third straight shutout and 13th consecutive victory.

title: PGA: McIlroy's driver was among 50 or so tested
content: Rory McIlroy was one of roughly 50 players whose drivers were tested before the PGA Championship as part of a normal procedure aimed at monitoring club limits.

title: Antonio Brown briefly detained at boxing event
content: Antonio Brown was briefly detained by police early Saturday following an altercation in which gunshots were fired outside a celebrity boxing event in Miami.

title: With a three-shot lead, Scottie Scheffler looks inevitable at the PGA Championship
content: After a torrid finish to his third round, Scheffler is in full control of the year's second major. Can anyone make it a contest on Sunday?

title: Morales puts division on notice with TKO of Burns
content: Michael Morales stamped himself as a real threat in the welterweight division with an impressive TKO.

title: How Boston avoids breaking up its roster, plus offseason guides for every NBA team
content: NBA front office insider Bobby Marks breaks down the summer priorities and needs for every eliminated team.

title: Nothing is impossible: Crystal Palace's first FA Cup win over Man City proves that
content: Crystal Palace win their first major trophy in 120 years by winning the FA Cup, while a possible rebuild for Manchester City becomes more evident.

title: Pep: 'Don't know' why Haaland didn't take pen
content: Pep Guardiola admitted he thought Erling Haaland would take Manchester City's penalty during their FA Cup final defeat to Crystal Palace and revealed it was "decided on the pitch" that Omar Marmoush would step up before his miss.

title: Henderson on avoiding red card: 'Who cares?'
content: Crystal Palace goalkeeper Dean Henderson said, "Who cares?" and insisted he knew he would save Omar Marmoush's penalty after an FA Cup final red card reprieve.

title: USMNT's Richards: FA Cup win means world to me
content: Alabama-native Chris Richards hailed his unlikely journey to becoming just the second American to play in and win an FA Cup final on Saturday.

title: Madrid confirm Huijsen signing; to play in CWC
content: Real Madrid have completed the signing of Bournemouth defender Dean Huijsen, the LaLiga club have confirmed.

title: Leverkusen set record with Alonso set to depart
content: Bayer Leverkusen came from a goal down to rescue a 2-2 draw at hosts Mainz 05 in the Bundesliga finale on Saturday and hand departing coach Xabi Alonso another record as they went two league seasons without an away defeat.

title: Gyökeres leads Sporting to title with 39th goal
content: Star striker Viktor Gyökeres helped to lead Sporting CP to their second consecutive Portuguese league title after Benfica was held off on the final day of the season on Saturday.

title: Fastest to 25: Chawinga sets NWSL scoring record
content: Temwa Chawinga's goal on Friday night secured a 1-0 win for the Kansas City Current against the Orlando Pride, making her the quickest player in NWSL history to reach 25 goals.

title: 49ers QB Brock Purdy is no longer Mr. Irrelevant: New contract comes with pressure to lead, win
content: San Francisco has long benefited from the league's best bargain contract. Now, it's on Purdy to deliver results.

title: How Alexis DeBoer has made a name for herself with Washington softball
content: While her famous dad went to Alabama to coach the Tide, Alexis DeBoer followed her dream to play for the Huskies.

title: A'ja Wilson leads WNBA's best dressed on opening weekend
content: Before the WNBA's best take the floor, they dazzled the pregame tunnel with their opening-night outfits.

title: Who are the best coaches in college football? We rank the top 10
content: Kirby Smart has to be No. 1, or does he? What about Ryan Day? Or Marcus Freeman? Who made our list -- and why.

title: Derek Carr retired, then an avalanche of unanswered questions followed
content: Derek Carr surprisingly announced his retirement on May 10. The decision -- and the timing -- has insiders throughout the league talking.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Rashford keen on Barcelona move
content: Marcus Rashford is reportedly still eyeing a move to Barcelona next season. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Welcome to Banditland: Buffalo eyeing an NLL championship three-peat
content: The Bandits are on the verge of history, while star Dhane Smith is also chasing down an all-time record -- owned by his coach.

title: Citizens come together for patriotic Tiranga rally on Hussainsagar
content: Starting from Ambedkar statue, the Tricolour rally ended near M-47 Patton Tank that was captured from a defeated Pakistan army during the 1971 war.

title: Gold merchants’ unions trade charges over ‘fund collection’ for Messi’s visit
content: One group says ₹10,000 was collected from gold and silver merchants by the rival group to fund Messi’s visit to State, the latter denies charges

title: Tiruchi Corporation steps up water safety measures
content: Health officials are engaged in inspecting the water supply network, collecting water samples, chlorinating the water, and monitoring the chlorine level

title: Ramakanth Joshi of Manohara Granthamala is dead
content: He had been leading Manohara Granthamala since 1993 after the death of his father, the noted writer G.B. Joshi

title: Once a painful form of self-protection, tattooed faces are now rare among women in Kandhamal
content: In this remote Odisha district, tribal women once tattooed their faces to appear less attractive — a painful tradition born out of resistance to sexual exploitation by landlords, royals, and British colonial rulers

title: FIR against Kuki student union president ‘for threatening’ Meiteis
content: Kangkan Kalita is a reporter with The Times of India and covers issues on health, education, stories of human interest while keeping a close watch on political developments and student movements. Reporting on environment and forest related issues and concerns of the northeast interest him equally.
